panels.description:
This shows the number of active connections on the server. Keep in mind the hard limit on the maximum number of connections set by your distribution.

You can read more about the [connection numbers](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/administration/analyzing-mongodb-performance/#number-of-connections).

targets.expr:
topk(5,(max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m])))

avg(max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]))

panels.title: Top 5 Connections

targets.expr:
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service", state="current"}[5m])

panels.description: This shows the number of open cursors for each shard in the cluster. A cursor in MongoDB is a pointer to the result of a given query that can be iterated over. By default a cursor times out after 10 minutes.

targets.expr:
topk(5,(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or 
mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"}))

avg(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or 
mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"})

panels.title: Top 5 Total Cursors

targets.expr:
mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="total"} or 
mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="total"}

panels.description: This shows the number of open cursors for each shard in the cluster. A cursor in MongoDB is a pointer to the result of a given query that can be iterated over. By default a cursor times out after 10 minutes.

mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="pinned"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="pinned"} or 
mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="pinned"})

mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="pinned"} or

panels.description: This shows the number of open cursors for each shard in the cluster. A cursor in MongoDB is a pointer to the result of a given query that can be iterated over. By default a cursor times out after 10 minutes.

topk(5,(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or
mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or

panels.title: Top 5 noTimeout Cursors

targets.expr:
mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or
mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or
mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"} or 
mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service", state="noTimeout"}

min(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[$interval]) / ignoring(state) 
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])
or
(irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[5m]) / ignoring(state) 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m]))
)

max(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[$interval]) / ignoring(state) 
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])
or
(irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[5m]) / ignoring(state) 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m]))
)

min(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])/ ignoring(state)
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[$interval])
or
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m])/ ignoring(state)
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[5m]))

max(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])/ ignoring(state)
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[$interval])
or
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m])/ ignoring(state)
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[5m]))

panels.description: This panel shows how efficient the queries running against this instance are. If the *INDEX* counter is low while queries are running it means you could be missing indexes that would support your queries. If the *DOCUMENT* counter is high it means that there are a lot of documents being returned per query and you might need to check to make sure your queries are returning only the data they need to.

targets.expr:
topk(5,(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[$interval]) / ignoring(state) 
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])
or
(irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[5m]) / ignoring(state) 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m]))
))

avg(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[$interval]) / ignoring(state) 
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])
or
(irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[5m]) / ignoring(state) 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m]))
)

panels.title: Top 5 Index Scan Ratios

targets.expr:
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[$interval]) / ignoring(state) 
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])
or
(irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned"}[5m]) / ignoring(state) 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m]))

panels.description: This panel shows how efficient the queries running against this instance are. If the *INDEX* counter is low while queries are running it means you could be missing indexes that would support your queries. If the *DOCUMENT* counter is high it means that there are a lot of documents being returned per query and you might need to check to make sure your queries are returning only the data they need to.

targets.expr:
topk(5,(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])/ ignoring(state)
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[$interval])
or
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m])/ ignoring(state)
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[5m])))

avg(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])/ ignoring(state)
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[$interval])
or
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m])/ ignoring(state)
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[5m]))

panels.title: Top 5 Document Scan Ratios

targets.expr:
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[$interval])/ ignoring(state)
rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[$interval])
or
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_document_total{service_name=~"$service", state="returned"}[5m])/ ignoring(state)
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state="scanned_objects"}[5m])

topk(5,(sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects"}) / ignoring(state)
sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects|scanned"})))

avg(sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects"}) / ignoring(state)
sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects|scanned"}))

sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects"}) / ignoring(state)
sum by (service_name) (mongodb_mongod_metrics_query_executor_total{service_name=~"$service", state=~"scanned_objects|scanned"})

sum(rate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type!="command"}[5m])) + 
sum(rate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[5m]) or
rate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_repl_total{service_name=~"$service", type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[5m])) +
sum(rate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_ttl_deleted_documents_total{service_name=~"$service"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongod_metrics_ttl_deleted_documents_total{service_name=~"$service"}[5m]) or
rate(mongodb_mongos_metrics_ttl_deleted_documents_total{service_name=~"$service"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_metrics_ttl_deleted_documents_total{service_name=~"$service"}[5m]))

panels.description: The average rate of commands performed per second over the selected sample period

targets.expr:
topk(5,sum by (service_name) (rate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m])))

avg(sum by (service_name) (rate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongod_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_total{service_name=~"$service", type="command"}[5m])))

panels.description: This panel shows the actual number of documents that were affected on average during the given time period. A single *update* command for example could perform updates on hundreds or thousands of documents. If these counters seem high, you might want to check your statements to make sure they are properly operating against the documents that they should.
panels.title: Top 5 Document Delete Operations

panels.description: This shows the number of read and write operations that are waiting due to for a lock. Consistently small values here should not be of concern, but if the values are consistently high the queries causing long lock times should be tracked down and fixed.
panels.title: Top 5 Queued Read Operations

panels.description: This shows the number of read and write operations that are waiting due to for a lock. Consistently small values here should not be of concern, but if the values are consistently high the queries causing long lock times should be tracked down and fixed.
panels.title: Top 5 Queued Write Operations

panels.description: This panel shows the number of assert events per second on average over the given time period. In most cases assertions are trivial, but you would want to check your log files if this counter spikes or is consistently high.
panels.title: Top 5 Assert Msg Events
